root: ^(Fred is playfully staring out the window...)

Start: ^FRED! There's my favorite little ball of light, how are you doing buddy!
^Hi Graciana! I have today off so I wanted to stop by and say hi!
^Well hello to you too Fred, would you like something to eat? I can check if we have any more lava lamps?
^Yes please! If you have the rainbow one I’ll have that one! I saw one in a catalog last night and it looked really fruity!
^If you can’t eat normal food, do you even know what fruit tastes like?
^(I go to the storage closet in the back and dig around...)
^(Surely I won't find another lava lamp, right...?)
^(And right as I say that... Another lava lamp, new in the box, as if it magically appeared before my eyes.)
^(...How many lava lamps do we have??)
^(Regardless, I take it out of the box and bring it out to Fred.)
^Here ya go, we didn’t have rainbow but there was a blue and orange mix!
^Mmm... Tastes almost like a fizzy drink!
^You haven’t had fizzy drinks either have you?
^Frank keeps talking about how good your food is, and I want to be a part of it.
^Aw that sounds sweet, is Frank one of your crew?
^Yeah! He's the one that made the suit for me!
^...Well it was already made, but he made it a penguin for me because I wanted to fly!
^(Do I tell him Penguins can’t fly...? No, it would break his little heart.)
^Well he sounds great! Do you spend a lot of time with Frank?
^But between you and me, I think he just likes to look out for me so he does both his route and mine with me.
^He sounds like a great guy! Do you like going on your route with Frank?
^Yeah, but lately he's been too busy to come along with me...
^But I'm sure he will eventually come back and walk with me right?

c-0: ^Of course! He sounds like he cares about you a lot! I'm sure he will come back
^I hope so, I like talking to people on my route, but sometimes I don't know what to say, and Frank helps me find the right words.
^(Thank goodness this kid has a parent figure in his life...)
^If Frank cares so much about helping you find friends, and working even more just to spend time with you, I think there's nothing that can stop him from coming back.
^Hey, it's what friends are for, right?
^Do friends also pay for meals when you don't have money?
^It's on the house bud, but next time maybe ask Frank for a little lamp money, huh?
^...But like actually please don't mention it to anyone...
c-1: ^Well even if he doesn’t, you'll still be able to make other friends on your route, right?
^I don't know, he really did a lot for me before, I don't think I can do much without him...
^(Hot damn, this kid might be too attached for his own good...)
^(Maybe I can help make him a little more indepedent so he can make some new friends.)
^When you came in to talk to me, was Frank with you?
^We sure are! So if you came in here by yourself, and we are now friends...
^You helped me find the right things to say...
^So you're offering to help me meet new friends and talk to them right?!
^(Welp... Not exactly what I was getting at...)
^(But how can I say no to those eyes...)
^Exactly Fred, right again! You're on a roll today!
^Woohoo! This is going to be so fun!

^You can come on my route with me, and I can show you all the fun I have with delivering packages and then we can get lava lamps and ice cream, and maybe even you can show me some of the cartoons Frank was talking about
^(Graciana, you have dug your own grave...)
^Here's the thing Fred, I can't quite leave just yet.
^I work for a long, long, loooong time during the week, but maybe Sunday you could show me your route?
c-2: ^What if he doesn't come back? Would you be okay?
^...He does a lot for me... Without him, I don't know what I would do...
^(I read the cover page of "Success And How To Do It", I got this...)
^You came here and made a friend all by yourself, do you really... need Frank?
^If he's busy, your life can't just stop, right? I'm sure you will be just fine without him
^And it's not Frank that has you delivering packages with him everyday, right? Whether it's right or wrong it's UMS.
^Which, side-note, you know you can make friends without delivering them something right?
^But they said I need to pay off the suit, and that it would be a great way to meet people, too...
^Something about murdering two birds with one rock...
^Well, that's good. I was worried about the birds
^(There are plenty of things for a kid to do with his life, working for UMS doesn't have to be one of them.)
^(Also child labor is illegal, but that's a whole complicated conversation... Especially if he's technically five thousand years old...)
^So the UMS people aren't't nice people? All of them, and Frank helping me, wasn't them being nice?
^Not exactly! Frank could be nice despite working there, but you should be careful with how easily you trust people.
^Just take some time to think about whether or not you want to be delivering packages, or maybe doing something else without the burden of working, so you can at least wear the penguin suit.
^We can find you a different suit that doesn't require constant labor to wear!

Next: ^But I do want to circle back real quick...
^Fred, did you say you were made from a star?
^I don't know what you're confused about.
^The only thing I remember about my birth was an explosion, and bits of star dust coming together over a few thousand years, until I became...
^Oh, I guess this just felt the most natural to me after I got into the suit!
^So you adapted to the suit? I thought it was the other way around?
^I don't really understand it, but I just found this to be more comfortable then what I was before
^I honestly don't remember, it's been so long...

c-0: ^Would you want to know more about your past?
^I saw the application to this job in a dream, so I don't really understand much about the outer worlds or "The Great Void" in general...
^But! You could ask O'Ryan about it, if you would like to maybe learn a little more about yourself?
^(Now that I think about it, I have no idea what O'Ryan is...)
^I don't know, do you think I should? I remember bits and pieces of how I was before, but I'm pretty happy with the past few hundred years.
^Yeah! I lost count after three hundred because work was distracting.
c-1: ^Do you think life is better now working for UMS?
^Well its been fun making friends on my deliveries for a while, but its gotten better now that I've met more people, like you and Frank!
^Aww that's nice Fred, when did you and Frank first meet?
^Well he had been working at UMS before I got there, but he was in a different department, so I never saw him.
^I think he got moved to my route 300ish years ago?

Final: ^Have you been paying off that suit for hundreds of years?!
^(Typical corporations taking advantage of their workers...)
^(I better make sure this Frank guy hasn't been using him, too...)
^So Fred, during all that time, when did you and Frank become close?
^Well, he started giving me advice on how to make friends and talk to people at first.
^But then after a while he started just talking to me while we were going to deliveries, about his day and the people he met the night before!
^The night before? Fred, when do you work?
^So he works a night shift, and then works a morning to afternoon shift with you?
^(What the hell is Frank? There's no time to sleep or eat...)
^And Fred, do you know what Frank is?
^No, like, you're a star child, or spaceborn, or...
^You get my point, what is Frank?
^I think he is human, or at least he looks human.
^Oh, but he does have a Black cat named May too!
^(Guy who never sleeps, looks human, and has a Black cat... This guys either a wizard or some Eldritch Creature...)
^(But it doesn't sound like he's all bad news with how much Fred adores him...)
^Well, Frank's awesomness aside, I think you should talk to your boss about your work. There is no way a suit can be worth three hundred plus years of work.
^How much was the suit? Do you remember what they said?
^Well here's what I'm going to ask you to do Fred, when you go back to work from your break, go see Frank and ask him the number, and have him write it down for me.
^Because unless you stumbled into one of the universes most expsenive prototype space suits I doubt it costs 300 years of work. Something about that seems wrong.
^And if you really trust Frank and he cares for you, see if he can help you cut a better deal with UMS, because it seems like you like your delivery route, right?
^Yeah! I've met a lot of nice people!
^That's great Fred! So how about this, sometime this week when you have another break, come stop by and see me, and you can tell me all about what happened over an orange swirl.
^Come back after talking with Frank and UMS, and you just might find out!
^(It's just an orange lava lamp from home I'll put in the blender, with some cream to make an orange sherbet flavor...)
^I will! Bye Graciana! See you soon!
^(He waves as he exits through the portal.)
^Okay... Didn't think I'd be basically babysitting, but... I think I got this...
monday: ^I didn't think Mondays were busy, though...
^Well, time to unlock tha portal, ya?
tuesday: ^Ya ever wake up and think, "ah man, I coulda been famous!"
^Well, I don't! I love it here! Ahahaha!
^Another Tuesday in tha kitchen, surrounded by food!
^...I wish I had your optimism, Chef...
^Ay, time to unlock the portal. Ya ready, Graciana?
wednesday: ^Somethin' feels off. Like, tha energy of tha food is screamin' at me...
^There's somethin' I tell ya... Somethin' goin' on...
^Go an' open up tha portal, ya?
thursday: ^Ay, had a long night of cookin'...
^Nothin' in particular, was just experimentin' with some stuff.
^...You stayed up all night for that? On a Thursday?
^Ya. Why wouldn't I? I had a lot of ideas!
friday: ^We got a big day ahead of us!
^Fridays get busy, an' CeCe ain't here.
^Good! 'Cause I'ma be stuck in the kitchen all day!
^Aight! let's crack open the portal and get rockin'!
saturday: ^Saturdays are busy too, huh? That makes sense.
^Ay, very! Another day in the kitchen for me!
^Ay, unlock the portal and let's get crackin'!
